channel.title: Mind Your Own Business™ - mp3 version
channel.itunes:subtitle: The Antidote To Business Advice
channel.itunes:author: Guy Kingston
channel.itunes:summary: By Entrepreneurs for Entrepreneurs – a podcast packed with savvy tips and secrets of success for start-ups, entrepreneurs, small business owners and franchises
channel.description: By Entrepreneurs for Entrepreneurs – a podcast packed with savvy tips and secrets of success for start-ups, entrepreneurs, small business owners and franchises
channel.itunes:keywords: myob, smll, buisness, busineses, busness, entrepreneur, startup, entrepeneur, entrepeneurs, entrepreneurs, start up

item.title: #131 What A Rogue!
item.itunes:author: Guy Kingston
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with, and tips from, Chris Benjamin, Rogue CFO
item.itunes:summary: This Mind Your Own Business podcast features and interview with Chris Benjamin, aka Rogue CFO. Chris offers outsourced Chief Financial Officer services to venture backed start-ups. In this podcast he gives listeners some useful tips on managing their cash and developing a growing business. The interview is followed by a studio discussion between Guy Kingston, John Richards and Christina Jones.
item.itunes:keywords: startup, venture capital, angel investment, start a business

item.title: #130 Young Entrepreneurs
item.itunes:author: Guy Kingston
item.itunes:subtitle: Starting a business is a viable career option whatever your age
item.itunes:summary: In this edition of the Mind Your Own business podcast we feature an interview with the founder of the Young Entrepreneur Council, Scott Gerber, followed by a studio discussion between Guy Kingston, Christina Jones and John Richards. In an engaging interview, Scott Gerber breaks from the orthodoxy that a start up needs external finance (99% don’t get any) and that every venture has to be based on high tech innovation. Instead, we walk through ‘what it’s like on the ground’ for those of us who really do start a business rather than just talk about doing so one day. What sort of ideas work? How is it going to be financed?
item.itunes:keywords: startup, venture capital, angel investment, start a business

item.title: #129 Times of Turmoil
item.itunes:author: Guy Kingston
item.itunes:subtitle: Q. How will events in the Middle East effect your business? A. More than you might imagine.
item.itunes:summary: To say the events in the Middle East will have far reaching consequences has become a cliché. But, as far as our businesses are concerned those events are likely to have more impact than we may at first realise. Guy Kingston, John Richards and Christina Jones discuss what the effects of all this turmoil may be.

item.title: #127 Interview
item.itunes:author: Guy Kingston
item.itunes:subtitle: Discussions with three leading thinkers in the world of entrepreneurship
item.itunes:summary: In a departure from our regular format we feature interviews with Doug Palmer, Murray Smith and Phil Simon. Each has three top tips for entrepreneurs, ensuring this show is packed with useful advice
item.itunes:keywords: advice, guru, start up, small business, growth, success

item.title: #126 The Devil’s Currency
item.itunes:author: Guy Kingston
item.itunes:subtitle: What impact will the Euro crisis have on our businesses worldwide?
item.itunes:summary: What future for the Euro? Is it really the work of evil our show title suggests? Following bail outs for Greece and Ireland, with others looking likely to follow for Spain and Portugal in 2011, Guy Kingston, Christina Jones and John Richards examine the impact the current Euro crisis will have not just throughout Europe but on global business as a whole.
item.itunes:keywords: ERM, exchange rates, gold standard, credit crunch, exchange controls, ECB, Eire
